Wheeler]] |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=12 March 1971 |Ship decommissioned=1 July 1999 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck=1 July 1999 |Ship reinstated= |Ship fate= Scrapping via [[Ship and Submarine Recycling Program]] completed 26 April 2000 |Ship status= |Ship motto=Spirit of 76 |Ship badge=[[File:Insignia of SSN-676 Billfish.PNG|200px]] }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class=[[Sturgeon class submarine|''Sturgeon''-class]] [[attack submarine]] |Ship displacement={{convert|3978|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} light<br />{{convert|4270|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} full<br />{{convert|292|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} dead |Ship length={{convert|292|ft|3|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|31|ft|8|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draft= {{convert|28|ft|8|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship decks= |Ship deck clearance= |Ship power=15,000 [[shaft horsepower]] (11.2 [[megawatt]]s) |Ship propulsion= One [[S5W reactor|S5W]] [[nuclear reactor]], two [[steam turbine]]s, one [[Propeller|screw]] |Ship speed={{convert|15|kn|lk=in}} surfaced<br />{{convert|25|kn}} submerged |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth=1,300 feet (396 meters) |Ship complement=109 (14 [[Commissioned officer|officers]], 95 [[Enlisted man|enlisted men]]) |Ship time to activate= |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=4 × {{convert|21|in|mm|0|sing=on}} [[torpedo tube]]s |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''Billfish'' (SSN-676)''', a [[Sturgeon class submarine|''Sturgeon''-class]] [[attack submarine]], was the second ship of the [[United States Navy]] to be named for the [[billfish]], a name used for any fish, such as [[gar]] or [[spearfish]], with bill-shaped jaws. ==Construction and commissioning== [[File:USS Billfish (SSN-676) launching.jpg|300px|thumb|left|''Billfish'' being [[Ship naming and launching|launched]] at [[Groton, Connecticut|Groton]], [[Connecticut]], on 1 May 1970.]]The contract to build ''Billfish'' was awarded to the [[Electric Boat]] Division of [[General Dynamics]] Corporation in [[Groton, Connecticut|Groton]], [[Connecticut]], on 15 July 1966 and her keel was laid down on 20 September 1968. She was [[ship naming and launching|launched]] on 1 May 1970 sponsored by Mrs. Earle G. Wheeler, the wife of [[Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff]] [[General (United States)|General]] [[Earle G. Wheeler]] (1908–1975), and [[Ship commissioning|commissioned]] on 12 March 1971 with [[Commander]] Richard M. Hughes in command. ==Service history== [[File:DSRV-2 Avalon aboard USS Billfish (SSN-676).jpg|300px|thumb|left|The [[Mystic class deep submergence rescue vehicle|''Mystic''-class]] [[Deep Submergence Rescue Vehicle|deep submergence rescue vehicle]] [[DSRV-2 Avalon|DSRV-2 ''Avalon'']] aboard ''Billfish''.]] {{Expand section|history for 1971-1980s|date=January 2010}} ''Billfish'' was one of the few submarines fitted to carry [[Mystic class deep submergence rescue vehicle]] during the 1980s. {{Expand section|history for 1980s-1999|date=January 2010}} ==Decommissioning and disposal== ''Billfish'' was [[Ship decommissioning|decommissioned]] on 1 July 1999 and stricken from the [[Naval Vessel Register]] the same day. Her scrapping via the Nuclear-Powered [[Ship and Submarine Recycling Program]] at [[Puget Sound Naval Shipyard]] in [[Bremerton, Washington|Bremerton]], [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]], was completed on 26 April 2000. [[File:USS Billfish (SSN-676) pierside.jpg|300px|left|thumb|''Billfish'' [[pier]]side.]] ==References== *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/b6/billfish-ii.htm}} *{{NVR|http://www.nvr.navy.mil/nvrships/details/SSN676.htm}} *[http://www.navsource.org/archives/08/08676.htm NavSource Online: Submarine Photo Archive Billfish (SSN-676)] ==External links== {{Commons category|USS Billfish (SSN-676)}} * [http://ussbillfish.com/ USS ''Billfish'' SSN 676] (Web site created by former USS ''Billfish'' (SSN-676) crew member) {{Sturgeon_class_submarine}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2011}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Billfish (Ssn-676)}} [[Category:Ships built in Connecticut]] [[Category:Sturgeon-class submarines]] [[Category:Cold War submarines of the United States]] [[Category:Nuclear ships of the United States Navy]] [[Category:1970 ships]] {{US-submarine-stub}}
